result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Melissa Marie Holtz appeared by video.  Attorney Carl W Knepel appeared by video for Melissa Marie Holtz.  Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense waives reading of the complaint and reserves all other jurisdictional rights and objections. 
Not guilty plea(s).  Jury calendar. 
Offer deadline 12-02-2022 
Scheduling conference 01-11-2023 at 11:20am
Scheduling conference on January 11, 2023 at 11:20 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Melissa Marie Holtz
Current: W10378 Island Lake Lane, Gresham, WI 54128 United States  (Effective: 10-06-2022)
Prior: W10378 Island Lake Ln., Gresham, WI 54128
Initial appearance on October 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.
RE:  Criminal damage to property as repeater-dvo, on 09-18-22.
Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of disorderly conduct-dvo and criminal damage to property-dvo.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 10-13-22 at 10:30 a.m. B-15.  Bail is set at $450.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that she have no contact with R.A.U., DOB: 02-28-1992 and with the premises at 10622 W. Belmar Avenue, Maribel, WI.  The court will allow a one time contact with the residence, with the aid of law enforcement, after the 72 hour no contact provision has expired, to obtain personal belongings.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody. 
Minutes.
